intro: Astragalus ingrata, commonly known as the poor man's milkweed, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, yellowish to greenish flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has palmately divided leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Astragalus ingrata is part of the legume family and has the ability to fix nitrogen, which can improve soil fertility.
